alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 3:44PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Franklin County through 415 PM CDT... At 343 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tims Ford Lake, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winchester, Decherd, Estill Springs, Cowan, Tims Ford Lake, Sewanee, Lexie Crossroads, Harmony, Maxwell and Beans Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
